newsitem.title: USA: US West Coast crudes ease with WTI, ANS stays flat.
newsitem.headline: US West Coast crudes ease with WTI, ANS stays flat.

text.p: U.S. West Coast crudes drifted lower early with benchmark West Texas Intermediate (WTI). But differentials for Alaska crude were unchanged after Monday's deal between BP America and a key California refiner.
Differentials stood at a $2.20 discount to December WTI, up 10 cents from the previous discount.
BP raised its offer price 20 cents to $1.90 a barrel off of WTI following the higher deal, a trader said.
Absolute prices for Dec WTI fell 10 cents to $23.20/23.30 a barrel, pushing outright ANS prices to $20.90/21.20.
Line 63 crude also fell 10 cents with WTI to $20.00/20.30 a barrel.
Arco said it moved up the deadline for Line 63 shippers' nominations to late next week or early next.
Wilmington remained at $18.15/$18.25 a barrel, while Kern River crude stayed $16.65/$16.85 a barrel.
